page.title: 11FARMING AROUND STACKSTEADS
page.content: My name is James Law and I live at Mitchell Field Nook Farm. It is quite a big farm for around here, but I suppose it is quite small as farms go. We keep alot of pigs and some sheep. We have a slaughterhouse in Stacksteads where the pigs are sent to be butchered. Our type of farm is called a hill farm, which is what they all are around here. The soil is not suitable for growing crops and the climate is not very good either. We are quite high up too. Although there are alot of farms, the men who live there often have other jobs as well because you cannot make enough from farming alone. Many, like Michael Bosworth's dad are haulage contractors and do odd jobs with their lorries.
